verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%>. Howl <S%H3213><s%>, ye ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%>; for it is laid waste <S%H7703><s%>, so that there is no house <S%H1004><s%>, no entering in <S%H935><s%>: from the land <S%H776><s%> of Kittim <S%H3794><s%> it is revealed to them <S%H1540><s%>.

Be still <S%H1826><s%>, ye inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coast <S%H339><s%>, thou whom the merchants <S%H5503><s%> of Sidon <S%H6721><s%>, that pass over <S%H5674><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%>, have replenished <S%H4390><s%>.

And on great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> the seed <S%H2233><s%> of the Shihor <S%H7883><s%>, the harvest <S%H7105><s%> of the Nile <S%H2975><s%>, was her revenue <S%H8393><s%>; and she was the mart <S%H5505><s%> of nations <S%H1471><s%>.

Be thou ashamed <S%H954><s%>, O Sidon <S%H6721><s%>; for the sea <S%H3220><s%> hath spoken <S%H559><s%>, the stronghold <S%H4581><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, I have not travailed <S%H2342><s%>, nor brought forth <S%H3205><s%>, neither have I nourished <S%H1431><s%> young men <S%H970><s%>, nor brought up <S%H1431><s%> virgins <S%H1330><s%>.
When the report <S%H8088><s%> cometh to Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, they shall be sorely pained <S%H2342><s%> at the report <S%H8088><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%>.
Pass ye over <S%H5674><s%> to Tarshish <S%H8659><s%>; wail <S%H3213><s%>, ye inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the coast <S%H339><s%>.

Is this your joyous <S%H5947><s%> city <S%H6927><s%>, whose antiquity is of ancient <S%H6924><s%> days <S%H3117><s%>, whose feet <S%H7272><s%> carried <S%H2986><s%> her afar off <S%H7350><s%> to sojourn <S%H1481><s%>?

Who hath purposed <S%H3289><s%> this against Tyre <S%H6865><s%>, the bestower of crowns <S%H5849><s%>, whose merchants <S%H5503><s%> are princes <S%H8269><s%>, whose traffickers <S%H3667><s%> are the honorable <S%H3513><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>?

Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> hath purposed <S%H3289><s%> it <S%H2490><s%>, to stain the pride <S%H1347><s%> of all glory <S%H6643><s%>, to bring into contempt <S%H7043><s%> all the honorable <S%H3513><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.
Pass <S%H5674><s%> through thy land <S%H776><s%> as the Nile <S%H2975><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%>; there is no restraint any more <S%H4206><s%>.

He hath stretched out <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> over the sea <S%H3220><s%>, he hath shaken <S%H7264><s%> the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%>: Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath given commandment <S%H6680><s%> concerning Canaan <S%H3667><s%>, to destroy <S%H8045><s%> the strongholds <S%H4581><s%> thereof <S%H4581><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Thou shalt no more <S%H3254><s%> rejoice <S%H5937><s%>, O thou oppressed <S%H6231><s%> virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Sidon <S%H6721><s%>: arise <S%H6965><s%>, pass over <S%H5674><s%> to Kittim <S%H3794><s%>; even there shalt thou have no rest <S%H5117><s%>.

Behold <S%H776><s%>, the land of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>: this people <S%H5971><s%> was not <S%H804><s%>; the Assyrian founded <S%H3245><s%> it for them that dwell in the wilderness <S%H6728><s%>; they set up <S%H6965><s%> their towers <S%H971><s%>; they overthrew <S%H6209><s%> the palaces <S%H759><s%> thereof <S%H7760><s%>; they made it a ruin <S%H4654><s%>.
Howl <S%H3213><s%>, ye ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%>; for your stronghold <S%H4581><s%> is laid waste <S%H7703><s%>.

And it shall come to pass in that day <S%H3117><s%>, that Tyre <S%H6865><s%> shall be forgotten <S%H7911><s%> seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, according to the days <S%H3117><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> king <S%H4428><s%>: after the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> it shall be unto Tyre <S%H6865><s%> as in the song <S%H7892><s%> of the harlot <S%H2181><s%>.

Take <S%H3947><s%> a harp <S%H3658><s%>, go about <S%H5437><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%>, thou harlot <S%H2181><s%> that hast been forgotten <S%H7911><s%>; make sweet <S%H3190><s%> melody <S%H5059><s%>, sing many <S%H7235><s%> songs <S%H7892><s%>, that thou mayest be remembered <S%H2142><s%>.

And it shall come to pass after the end <S%H7093><s%> of seventy <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, that Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> will visit <S%H6485><s%> Tyre <S%H6865><s%>, and she shall return <S%H7725><s%> to her hire <S%H868><s%>, and shall play the harlot <S%H2181><s%> with all the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> of the world <S%H776><s%> upon the face <S%H6440><s%> of the earth <S%H127><s%>.

And her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> and her hire <S%H868><s%> shall be holiness <S%H6944><s%> to Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>: it shall not be treasured <S%H686><s%> nor laid up <S%H2630><s%>; for her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> shall be for them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, to eat <S%H398><s%> sufficiently <S%H7654><s%>, and for durable <S%H6266><s%> clothing <S%H4374><s%>.
